text: We will hear arguments next in number 53, Richardson against Belcher.
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

Mr. Chief Justice and may I please the Court, the District Court interpreting Goldberg versus Kelly has determined the welfare was a property right, and therefore protected by Due Property Clause, however to distinguish between welfare and Social Security was illogical, and grossly inequitable, and further they held that Section 224, of the Social Security Act arbitrarily discriminated between the disabled worker and other disabled persons.
Mr. Chief Justice, I have nothing further.
